resources:
Rorschach Test //activity 1
Start test This application is an opportunity to take a test invented in 1921 by psychiatrist and psychologist Hermann Rorschach. This test is not current, and both the cards and the key to the test were created over 100 years ago. The test you are about to take is a chance to see how you would have been diagnosed at the beginning of the last century. activity_test Human figures Animals Something fantastic Inanimate objects
What do you see in the picture?
activity testd Is it in motion? Yes No
activity testdd your association applies to the whole picture?
activity testddd Describe how clear and colorful the image was The image is fuzzy and not bright At first, the shape is recognized, and then perhaps the color At first, the color is captured, and then the shape
end test TV1 You often show interest in human relationships of any type (favorable and unfavorable) Your answers indicate a weakly expressed individuality, stereotypical standard thinking. Judging by your answers, you are a person with a penchant for construction, fantasy and confabulation The answers you gave indicate a tendency to autism, difficulty in interpersonal relationships. In the field of organizing actions â€” as a tendency to concretization.
TV2 Your answers are an indicator of the ability and desire for integration ,reviewing and encompassing type of perception, the synthetic way of thinking, the ability to abstract You tend to be influenced by affect and emotions. Evidence of the predominance of affective processes over other mental processes. Your answers are a sign of "narrowed consciousness", impulsivity and lack of control A large number of details in your answers is an indicator of the "fragmentation" of attention, its narrowness, fragmentation and illogical thinking; The perception of white gaps and the construction of images based on them is an indicator of negativism or the defensive position of the subject Your answers are :1) an indicator of the dominance of thought over feeling; 2) an indicator of compensatory phenomena when, through reflection, reasoning, they "extinguish" or try to lower affect or emotion. In this case, it is possible to diagnose hidden fear, anxiety, fear of "dissolving" emotions. Your answers are an indicator of the subject\'s introversive tendency, an indicator of the richness and flexibility of the associative process. A sign of independent associative work, often without external impulses.
